main event: A large, square, 40-50 pound block of ice fell out of the sky on October 26, 1959, near Toccoa, Georgia.
interesting points: Witnesses described the ice as making a loud whistly rustling sound as it fell,The ice was analyzed and found to be artificially made and possibly radioactive,Initial reports of radiation were later disputed by further testing,The sighting led to multiple analyses, including one by the Army Snow and Permafrost Research Laboratory,Officers noted similar incidents have occurred previously in other locations.
witness description: The object was reported by Mr. [REDACTED] who observed it fall.
